snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said his tactics of offering more help to failing schools, and providing social services to students and families there, differed sharply from his predecessor’s.
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio announces a new approach to fixing New York City’s most troubled public schools, offering them more money and staffing, extending the length of their day, and arranging for social services to be delivered to students and families on site.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio said his tactics of offering more help to failing schools, and providing social services to students and families there, differed sharply from his predecessor’s.

headline.main: De Blasio Unveils New Plans for Troubled Schools in New York
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Unveils New Plans for Troubled Schools
